alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha; Lincoln; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 6:25PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Heavy rain and strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Kanawha, central Putnam, northeastern Lincoln and north central Boone Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 624 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms near Alum Creek, or 9 miles southwest of Charleston, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Winfield, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Sissonville, Eleanor, Marmet, Poca, Cross Lanes, Alum Creek, Institute, Tornado, Teays Valley, Bancroft, Sod and Ashford. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 98 and 115. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 33 and 57. Route 119 between mile markers 60 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
